<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REAL ESTATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/30/sell-haunted-house?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
How Creepy Disappearing Twins Affect Resale Value
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Halloween haunted house" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yOTkxL2hhbGxvd2Vlbl9oYXVudGVkX2hvdXNlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Haunted houses represent a mainstay of Halloween and the horror/mystery genre, from <em>The Shining</em> to Scooby, Velma, and Shaggy's exploits. But they also represent a horrific, and very real, headache for realtors. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Believe it or not, hauntedness is a legal designation in the real estate industry. If a structure is haunted, it's considered "stigmatized," which means that while there are no material defects, the home "elicits an emotional response," <a href="https://archive.curbed.com/2018/10/25/18001112/haunted-houses-stigma-realtors?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes</a> Curbed. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So how do you sell a haunted house? Depends on the state </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In New York, if the seller has "claimed to the public at large" that the house is haunted, he or she must disclose the spooky status to buyers. But, if you keep the ghost in the attic to yourself, you don't have to say anything to a prospective buyer. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In California, sellers </span><span><a href="http://zillow.mediaroom.com/2019-10-29-Selling-a-Haunted-House-Heres-What-You-Need-to-Know?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have to disclose</a></span><span> to buyers if there's been a death on the property within three years. In Alaska, it's one year. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Every now and then, a creepy vibe can be a selling point. Spokane, WA, realtor Marianne Bornhoft told Curbed she thought chilling rumors about a place called the Polly Judd house helped her sell it. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In the '60s and '70s, Polly Judd took in veterans and troubled people. Several suicides and deaths took place in the house and later owners seemed bedeviled by bad luck, shrouding the place in mystery. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Bornhoft said "the house was so iconic that I think that's what attracted the people to [it]." </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That seems to be the exception to rule, because haunted houses are typically not an easy sell. In fact, the presence of haunted houses has been shown to depress the value of homes in the surrounding neighborhood. One <a href="https://privpapers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=3679828&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recent study</a> of the Hong Kong housing market found that "prices drop on average 20% for units that become haunted, 10% for units on the same floor, 7% for units in the same block, and 1% for units in the same estate."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Are you looking for a spooky spot?</strong> You're in luck. Both Lynnewood Hall (dubbed the world's largest haunted house) in Elkins Park, PA, and the house from <em>The Silence of the Lambs</em> <a href="https://www.pennlive.com/life/2020/10/want-to-buy-a-haunted-house-worlds-biggest-ghost-house-is-up-for-sale-in-pa-for-16m-report.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">are on the market</a>. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/30/halloween-popup-shops-mixed-success-2020?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Demon Stores Look for New Hosts
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Spirit Halloween store" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yOTkwL3NwaXJpdF9oYWxsb3dlZW5fc3RvcmUuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Ben McCanna/Portland Portland Press Herald via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Every year, pop-up Halloween stores rise from the underworld to possess empty storefronts vacated by mortal retailers.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Typically, this non-traditional leasing model means seasonal pop-ups perform well when the rest of retail flounders. But even with 2020 laying out a feast of fresh retail corpses, are spooky stores immune to the pandemic? Let's check in with two retail reanimaters:</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Spirit Halloween</strong></span><span> is the host with the most. It actually opened </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/12/style/spirit-halloween-costume-store-undead-forever.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">more stores</a></span><span> this year (1,400+) than last year, and its CEO said last month the company is "anticipating a Halloween on par with last year."</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Party City</strong></span><span> was far less bullish, opening 91% fewer of its Halloween City locations this year. With just 25 stores across the U.S., these days it's more like a Halloween Town.</span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Halloween City was showing zombie-like symptoms even before the pandemic. Last year, sales per store declined nearly <a href="https://www.retaildive.com/news/party-citys-october-sales-a-disaster-with-halloween-stores-down-21/566955/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">21% annually</a>—a major problem for parent Party City considering Halloween sales account for a fifth of its total U.S. retail revenue. </p>

<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/30/halloween-candy-sales-86?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Halloween Never Tasted so Sweet
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="A gif of a man grabbing an armful of Halloween candy bags and throwing them into his shopping cart" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=378 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3HDf5pBcKqiCxT6O3z/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="A gif of a man grabbing an armful of Halloween candy bags and throwing them into his shopping cart" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/3HDf5pBcKqiCxT6O3z/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The pandemic has put a bigger damper on trick-or-treating than your neighbor who only hands out bags of pretzels. But even with more families staying home this year, candy sales have remained surprisingly resilient. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As of Oct. 4, Halloween chocolate and candy sales were <a href="https://www.fooddive.com/news/halloween-candy-sales-are-up-but-pandemic-is-changing-celebrations/587794/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">up 8.6% annually</a>, according to the National Confectioners Association. Sales at brick-and-mortar locations are up 26% (it helps that supplies hit shelves starting in July). </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Those mini Crunch bars are big business</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Shoppers spend $4.6 billion on Halloween treats, about 13% of the U.S.' annual candy sales. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Hershey's, Ferrero, and Mars Wrigley typically prepare their Halloween selection months in advance, but the pandemic forced them to "rethink how they produce, distribute, and sell their offerings to retailers and consumers, upending decades of conventional wisdom in the holiday staple category," Food Dive <a href="https://www.fooddive.com/news/pandemic-forces-halloween-candy-makers-to-get-creative-to-protect-5b-in-sa/585802/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>This year, Hershey's traded jumbo-packs for snack sizes and small bags of assorted candies. It also toned down its Halloween branding to avoid discounting inventory come Nov. 1.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> You're not alone in buying Costco packs of chocolate for yourself. The pandemic has sent anxious consumers back into the sweet, loving arms of <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/06/16/well/eat/pandemic-snacking-junk-food-habits-eating-weight.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">junk food</a>. </p>

<img class="story-header-image" alt="Squidward frowning while getting flower petals thrown at him" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/EhwFIP584mIBa/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Knott's Berry Farm in California was the first major theme park to host a Halloween celebration back in 1973, kicking off a long tradition of cringy puns with its "Knott's Scary Farm" event. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Since then, Halloween has turned into a turkey-leg-at-Disney-World-sized <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/11/coronavirus-threatens-theme-parks-lucrative-halloween-celebrations.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">revenue driver</a> for the theme park industry. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>According to Dennis Speigel, president of International Theme Parks Services, over 900,000 people came to Universal last year </span><span><em>just for Halloween</em></span><span>. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>And parks from Disney World to Busch Gardens report significant Q4 </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/05/halloween-drives-massive-traffic-and-sales-at-theme-parks.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">revenue bumps</a></span><span> every year thanks to Halloween celebrations. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">But like your ex once told you</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This year, things are different. Knott's Berry Farm is capping attendance at 10%–15% of capacity, while Universal Studios <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/24/coronavirus-universal-studios-cancels-halloween-horror-nights.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">canceled</a> its iconic "Halloween Horror Nights" at its California and Florida locations. Some parks like Disney World in Orlando have turned to merch sales to offset the lack of visitors, but not every operator has the benefit of Disney's cast of iconic characters. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>As the pandemic drags on into the winter months, theme parks risk losing more of the tentpole events they've historically relied on to support their bottom lines.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRENDS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/10/30/whats-trending-halloween?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Workin' at the Haunted Car Wash, Yeah
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

</table>
<img alt="Halloween google trends" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yOTg3L2hhbGxvd2Vlbl9nb29nbGVfdHJlbmRzLnBuZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Google Trends</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The hottest Halloween trend of 2020? <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/halloween-terror-now-on-the-drive-through-menu-11603912368?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Haunted car washes</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let's be honest—car washes have always been a bit scary. But this year, they're adding blood, guts, and performers to the whirling pom pom barrage (don't worry, the cars are cleaned at the end). </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What other Halloween trends are we watching this year? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Decor in general, </strong>but especially this <a href="https://slate.com/human-interest/2020/10/12-foot-skeleton-halloween-home-depot-review.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">12-foot-tall skeleton</a> that keeps selling out at Home Depot. The National Retail Federation predicts 4% more people plan to decorate their homes this year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Fortnitemares:</strong> Every online videogame seems to have an <a href="https://www.today.com/parents/halloween-events-minecraft-pokemon-go-fortnite-roblox-t195669?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">in-game event</a>. <em>Fortnite</em> and <em>Minecraft</em> are rolling out themed challenges and collectible items for players, while <em>Animal Crossing</em> lets island residents grow pumpkins and gather in the town square to celebrate. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">White sheets and black turtlenecks: </strong>Last month, TikTokers started donning simple white sheets with eye cutouts to dress up as <a href="https://www.tiktok.com/tag/ghostphotoshoot?_d=secCgsIARCbDRgBIAIoARI%2BCjyT6Xzy6s6wo8yLKc1Bmtd0xD1TrQSZ0F9foOL1yw09k%2FE3ZwAsN7MQcTWg9%2FRWIoyTtVEKsH49IudCnI8aAA%3D%3D&language=en&preview_pb=0&sec_user_id=MS4wLjABAAAAYi4flqtsqutbJtQwlc0OzJESdYib06i4rvIo4Ro4daMbIpLAwZtB3FGQjci8DIIk&share_item_id=6873114397871590657&share_link_id=CE3BFC40-4878-4241-98CE-9076E2740BC6&timestamp=1601081620&tt_from=copy&u_code=aia5ieefmim7l&user_id=236721550278823936&utm_campaign=client_share&utm_medium=ios&utm_source=copy&source=h5_m&lang=en&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">classic ghosts</a>, and the trend has ballooned since. Another popular fit? <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/halloween-costumes-elizabeth-holmes-steve-jobs-black-turtlenecks-silicon-valley-2019-10?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Elizabeth Holmes</a>. You can see what costumes are the most popular by exploring <a href="https://frightgeist.withgoogle.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Google's Frightgeist</a> site. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BREW'S BETS
</h3>

<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Double, double, bass and treble: </strong><a href="https://open.spotify.com/playlist/6qNseWSBwmZ5Om4QFWX58y?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">This playlist</a><span> pleases everyone and </span><a href="https://open.spotify.com/playlist/37i9dQZF1DXbuQyuab5Cy4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">this one</a><span> will please rowdy millennials. Plus, check out Phoebe Bridgers's </span><a href="https://open.spotify.com/playlist/37i9dQZF1DX5hol82XuK24?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spooky playlist</a><span> and "</span><a href="https://open.spotify.com/playlist/37i9dQZF1DXafCT9DHTijq?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Classical Halloween</a><span>" for haunted Victorian manor vibes.</span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Halloween grab bag:</strong> A map of each state's <a href="https://www.delish.com/food-news/a34346890/favorite-halloween-candy-by-state/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">favorite candy</a>, a tool for <a href="https://www.itsyourboo.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">un-ghosting</a> old boos, a haunted <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/30/style/modern-love-first-haunted-then-ghosted.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Modern Love</a> article, Netflix's <a href="https://www.netflix.com/title/81237854?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333"><em>The Haunting of Bly Manor</em></a>, and Jackbox's <a href="https://www.jackboxgames.com/trivia-murder-party/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Trivia Murder Party</a> game. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Weekend conversation starters:</strong></p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>What song, when played on repeat, would be the best weapon </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/MorningBrew/status/1321161506575257600?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">to annoy</a></span><span> someone with?</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>What old picture of yourself would be your album cover?</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>What do you plan to do with your extra hour of life later tonight? </span></li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Do you believe in ghosts? You should, because three of the following ghost-related headlines are true, while one we made up. Can you spot the fake? </p>

</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Tinder's </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/Rkt9N7lIm1IsKnh3tZ/giphy.gif?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">new feature</a></span><span> warns users when they're about to be 'ghosted'</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Dunkin' adds </span><span><a href="https://www.foxnews.com/food-drink/dunkin-spicy-ghost-pepper-donut-halloween-offerings?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spicy Ghost Pepper Donut</a></span><span><span> to traditional Halloween offerings</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>

width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8yOTkxL2hhbGxvd2Vlbl9oYXVudGVkX2hvdXNlLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHaunted houses represent a mainstay of Halloween and the horror/mystery genre, from \u003cem\u003eThe Shining\u003c/em\u003e to Scooby, Velma, and Shaggy's exploits. But they also represent a horrific, and very real, headache for realtors. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBelieve it or not, hauntedness is a legal designation in the real estate industry. If a structure is haunted, it's considered \"stigmatized,\" which means that while there are no material defects, the home \"elicits an emotional response,\" \u003ca href=\"https://archive.curbed.com/2018/10/25/18001112/haunted-houses-stigma-realtors?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites\u003c/a\u003e Curbed. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo how do you sell a haunted house? Depends on the state \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn New York, if the seller has \"claimed to the public at large\" that the house is haunted, he or she must disclose the spooky status to buyers. But, if you keep the ghost in the attic to yourself, you don't have to say anything to a prospective buyer. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn California, sellers \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"http://zillow.mediaroom.com/2019-10-29-Selling-a-Haunted-House-Heres-What-You-Need-to-Know?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehave to disclose\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e to buyers if there's been a death on the property within three years. In Alaska, it's one year. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEvery now and then, a creepy vibe can be a selling point. Spokane, WA, realtor Marianne Bornhoft told Curbed she thought chilling rumors about a place called the Polly Judd house helped her sell it. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn the '60s and '70s, Polly Judd took in veterans and troubled people. Several suicides and deaths took place in the house and later owners seemed bedeviled by bad luck, shrouding the place in mystery. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBornhoft said \"the house was so iconic that I think that's what attracted the people to [it].\" \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat seems to be the exception to rule, because haunted houses are typically not an easy sell. In fact, the presence of haunted houses has been shown to depress the value of homes in the surrounding neighborhood. One \u003ca href=\"https://privpapers.ssrn.com/sol3/papers.cfm?abstract_id=3679828\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erecent study\u003c/a\u003e of the Hong Kong housing market found that \"prices drop on average 20% for units that become haunted, 10% for units on the same floor, 7% for units in the same block, and 1% for units in the same estate.\"\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e+ Are you looking for a spooky spot?\u003c/strong\u003e You're in luck. Both Lynnewood Hall (dubbed the world's largest haunted house) in Elkins Park, PA, and the house from \u003cem\u003eThe Silence of the Lambs\u003c/em\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.pennlive.com/life/2020/10/want-to-buy-a-haunted-house-worlds-biggest-ghost-house-is-up-for-sale-in-pa-for-16m-report.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eare on the market\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEvery year, pop-up Halloween stores rise from the underworld to possess empty storefronts vacated by mortal retailers.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTypically, this non-traditional leasing model means seasonal pop-ups perform well when the rest of retail flounders. But even with 2020 laying out a feast of fresh retail corpses, are spooky stores immune to the pandemic? Let's check in with two retail reanimaters:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSpirit Halloween\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e is the host with the most. It actually opened \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/10/12/style/spirit-halloween-costume-store-undead-forever.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emore stores\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e this year (1,400+) than last year, and its CEO said last month the company is \"anticipating a Halloween on par with last year.\"\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eParty City\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e was far less bullish, opening 91% fewer of its Halloween City locations this year. With just 25 stores across the U.S., these days it's more like a Halloween Town.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eHalloween City was showing zombie-like symptoms even before the pandemic. Last year, sales per store declined nearly \u003ca href=\"https://www.retaildive.com/news/party-citys-october-sales-a-disaster-with-halloween-stores-down-21/566955/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e21% annually\u003c/a\u003e—a major problem for parent Party City style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe pandemic has put a bigger damper on trick-or-treating than your neighbor who only hands out bags of pretzels. But even with more families staying home this year, candy sales have remained surprisingly resilient. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs of Oct. 4, Halloween chocolate and candy sales were \u003ca href=\"https://www.fooddive.com/news/halloween-candy-sales-are-up-but-pandemic-is-changing-celebrations/587794/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eup 8.6% annually\u003c/a\u003e, according to the National Confectioners Association. Sales at brick-and-mortar locations are up 26% (it helps that supplies hit shelves starting in July). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThose mini Crunch bars are big business\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eShoppers spend $4.6 billion on Halloween treats, about 13% of the U.S.' annual candy sales. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHershey's, Ferrero, and Mars Wrigley typically prepare their Halloween selection months in advance, but the pandemic forced them to \"rethink how they produce, distribute, and sell their offerings to retailers and consumers, upending decades of conventional wisdom in the holiday staple category,\" Food Dive \u003ca href=\"https://www.fooddive.com/news/pandemic-forces-halloween-candy-makers-to-get-creative-to-protect-5b-in-sa/585802/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThis year, Hershey's traded jumbo-packs for snack sizes and small bags of assorted candies. It also toned down its Halloween branding to avoid discounting inventory come Nov. 1.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e You're not alone in buying Costco packs of chocolate for yourself. width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eKnott's Berry Farm in California was the first major theme park to host a Halloween celebration back in 1973, kicking off a long tradition of cringy puns with its \"Knott's Scary Farm\" event. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSince then, Halloween has turned into a turkey-leg-at-Disney-World-sized \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/10/11/coronavirus-threatens-theme-parks-lucrative-halloween-celebrations.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erevenue driver\u003c/a\u003e for the theme park industry. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAccording to Dennis Speigel, president of International Theme Parks Services, over 900,000 people came to Universal last year \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003ejust for Halloween\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAnd parks from Disney World to Busch Gardens report significant Q4 \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/05/halloween-drives-massive-traffic-and-sales-at-theme-parks.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erevenue bumps\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e every year thanks to Halloween celebrations. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eBut like your ex once told you\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThis year, things are different. Knott's Berry Farm is capping attendance at 10%–15% of capacity, while Universal Studios \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2020/07/24/coronavirus-universal-studios-cancels-halloween-horror-nights.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecanceled\u003c/a\u003e its iconic \"Halloween Horror Nights\" at its California and Florida locations. Some parks like Disney World in Orlando have turned to merch sales to offset the lack of visitors, but not every operator has the benefit of Disney's cast of iconic characters. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eAs the pandemic drags on into the winter months, theme parks risk losing more of the tentpole events they've historically relied on to support their bottom lines.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe hottest Halloween trend of 2020? \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/halloween-terror-now-on-the-drive-through-menu-11603912368?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eHaunted car washes\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLet's be honest—car washes have always been a bit scary. But this year, they're adding blood, guts, and performers to the whirling pom pom barrage (don't worry, the cars are cleaned at the end). \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eWhat other Halloween trends are we watching this year? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDecor in general, \u003c/strong\u003ebut especially this \u003ca href=\"https://slate.com/human-interest/2020/10/12-foot-skeleton-halloween-home-depot-review.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e12-foot-tall skeleton\u003c/a\u003e that keeps selling out at Home Depot. The National Retail Federation predicts 4% more people plan to decorate their homes this year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eFortnitemares:\u003c/strong\u003e Every online videogame seems to have an \u003ca href=\"https://www.today.com/parents/halloween-events-minecraft-pokemon-go-fortnite-roblox-t195669?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ein-game event\u003c/a\u003e. \u003cem\u003eFortnite\u003c/em\u003e and \u003cem\u003eMinecraft\u003c/em\u003e are rolling out themed challenges and collectible items for players, while \u003cem\u003eAnimal Crossing\u003c/em\u003e lets island residents grow pumpkins and gather in the town square to celebrate. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhite sheets and black turtlenecks: \u003c/strong\u003eLast month, TikTokers started donning simple white sheets with eye cutouts to dress up as \u003ca href=\"https://www.tiktok.com/tag/ghostphotoshoot?_d=secCgsIARCbDRgBIAIoARI%2BCjyT6Xzy6s6wo8yLKc1Bmtd0xD1TrQSZ0F9foOL1yw09k%2FE3ZwAsN7MQcTWg9%2FRWIoyTtVEKsH49IudCnI8aAA%3D%3D\u0026language=en\u0026preview_pb=0\u0026sec_user_id=MS4wLjABAAAAYi4flqtsqutbJtQwlc0OzJESdYib06i4rvIo4Ro4daMbIpLAwZtB3FGQjci8DIIk\u0026share_item_id=6873114397871590657\u0026share_link_id=CE3BFC40-4878-4241-98CE-9076E2740BC6\u0026timestamp=1601081620\u0026tt_from=copy\u0026u_code=aia5ieefmim7l\u0026user_id=236721550278823936\u0026utm_campaign=client_share\u0026utm_medium=ios\u0026utm_source=copy\u0026source=h5_m\u0026lang=en\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eclassic ghosts\u003c/a\u003e, and the trend has ballooned since. Another popular fit? \u003ca href=\"https://www.businessinsider.com/halloween-costumes-elizabeth-holmes-steve-jobs-black-turtlenecks-silicon-valley-2019-10?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eElizabeth Holmes\u003c/a\u003e.
